Class AccountDatabase

  • java.lang.Object
    • AccountDatabase

  • public class AccountDatabase
extends java.lang.Object
    This is an array-based container class with an initial capacity of 5. It will automatically grow the capacity by 5 if the database is full. The array shall hold different account instances in Checking, Savings or MoneyMarket.
    Author:
    Kaivalya Mishra, Ridwanur Sarder

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Account[] accounts 
      private int size 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AccountDatabase()
      Constructor to initialize an AccountDatabase

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean add(Account account)
      Adds an account to the database if it doesn't already exist in it.
      boolean deposit(Account account, double amount)
      Deposits money into account if it exists in database
      private int find(Account account)
      Finds an account in the database and returns its index.
      private void grow()
      Increases capacity of database when database exceeds current capacity.
      void printAccounts()
      Prints accounts in the database
      void printByDateOpen()
      Prints the database sorted by date accounts were opened in addition to information regarding interest, fee, and balance
      void printByLastName()
      Prints the database sorted by last name and information regarding interest, fee, and balance
      boolean remove(Account account)
      Removes an account from the database if it's in it
      private void sortByDateOpen()
      Sorts the database in ascending order by date accounts were opened.
      private void sortByLastName()
      Sort database in ascending order based on last name of account holder
      int withdrawal(Account account, double amount)
      Withdraws money from an account in database if it exists

    • Method Detail

      • find

        private int find(Account account)
        Finds an account in the database and returns its index.
        Parameters:
        account - to search for
        Returns:
        index of account if found, -1 otherwise

      • grow

        private void grow()
        Increases capacity of database when database exceeds current capacity.

      • add

        public boolean add(Account account)
        Adds an account to the database if it doesn't already exist in it.
        Parameters:
        account - to be added
        Returns:
        false if account already exists in the database, true if add is successful.

      • remove

        public boolean remove(Account account)
        Removes an account from the database if it's in it
        Parameters:
        account - to search for and remove
        Returns:
        true if account is found and removed, false if account doesn't exist in database

      • deposit

        public boolean deposit(Account account,
                       double amount)
        Deposits money into account if it exists in database
        Parameters:
        account - to receive money
        amount - of money to deposit
        Returns:
        true if account exists, false otherwise

      • withdrawal

        public int withdrawal(Account account,
                      double amount)
        Withdraws money from an account in database if it exists
        Parameters:
        account - to withdraw from
        amount - to take from account
        Returns:
        -1 if account doesn't exist, 1 if insufficient funds, and 0 if successful withdrawal

      • sortByDateOpen

        private void sortByDateOpen()
        Sorts the database in ascending order by date accounts were opened.

      • sortByLastName

        private void sortByLastName()
        Sort database in ascending order based on last name of account holder

      • printByDateOpen

        public void printByDateOpen()
        Prints the database sorted by date accounts were opened in addition to information regarding interest, fee, and balance

      • printByLastName

        public void printByLastName()
        Prints the database sorted by last name and information regarding interest, fee, and balance

        public void printAccounts()
        Prints accounts in the database
